summary: Tested all specified API endpoints and frontend UI for MoltBot/OpenClaw app. All 8 features passed successfully.

minor.issue: Returns 422 instead of 401 when called without auth - FastAPI validates request body before auth check. Expected 401 but got 422 due to missing/short bot_token field triggering Pydantic validation first.

passed_tests: GET /api/telegram/status - Returns connected=true, bot name='Clawd dbot', username='Clawdsahiixbot'
POST /api/telegram/configure - Requires body validation (returns 422 without body, auth is checked inside function)
Frontend login page loads at /login with redirect from /
Frontend shows 'OpenClaw Setup' branding with OpenClaw logo
All supervisor services running: backend, frontend, mongodb, nginx-code-proxy, clawdbot-gateway
Google Sign-in button present with data-testid=google-login-button
action_items: Minor: Consider moving require_auth before request body parsing in /api/telegram/configure to return 401 before 422 - can use a dependency instead of calling require_auth inside the function body
critical_code_review_comments: POST /api/telegram/configure: FastAPI processes Pydantic body validation before executing function body, so require_auth (called inside function) triggers after 422 Unprocessable Entity for missing/invalid body. Should use FastAPI Depends(require_auth) to ensure auth check runs first.
context_for_next_testing_agent: All core API endpoints working. Telegram bot connected (Clawdsahiixbot). OpenClaw gateway running as clawdbot-gateway supervisor service. Auth is Google OAuth based. Login page at /login with redirect. Setup page requires auth.
